intro: Heterolaena hispida, commonly known as roughleaf bushwillow, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Heterolaena hispida is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
